docs.text: Opportunities These opportunities focus on those available to students attending U.S high schools and Universities as these are the ones I am familliar with. Feel free to suggest additions in the Discord . Research Fellowship at National Institute of Standards and Technology Award: $10,000 - 20,000 Acceptance rate: 20 - 50% Criteria: Incomming and Current Undergraduate Assist with cutting-edge research at NIST working alongside a mentor at the laboratories in either Gaithersburg, Maryland or Boulder, Colorado. The program lasts for 11 weeks over the summer. Students can work one of 6 labs: Communications Technology Laboratory (CTL), Engineering Laboratory (EL), Information Technology Laboratory (ITL), Material Measurement Laboratory (MML), NIST Center for Neutron Research (NCNR), and Physical Measurement Laboratory (PML). If you're looking for Physics related research, look into NCNR or MML. I would recommend dorming with others and looking for AirBnB or similar housing to reduce costs. Apply for NIST Gaithersburg or NIST Boulder . Research Experience for Undergraduates Award: ~$5,000 Acceptance rate: Varies Criteria: Undergraduate This is a collection of programs offered by various research universities to allow students to visit and conduct research with professors. Use the NSF tool to search for an REU or browse by subject. REUs are useful for building connections and networking; building connections a university greatly improves your success rate in applying to their graduate program. Oak Ridge National Labs Internship Award: Varies Acceptance rate: Varies Criteria: Highschool - Graduate Various internship programs at ORNL focused on physics and math education. Contains many options for fundamental physics experimental research for undergraduates. Goldwater Scholarship Award: $7,500 - $15,000 Acceptance rate: ~30% Criteria: 2nd or 3rd year Undergraduate Research Scholarship to award undergraduates for excellence in academics. Speak to your university's office of nationally competitive awards to apply. The application includes a personal statement about your experiences and goals, as well as a research proposal or a write-up of previous research. Astronaut Scholarship Award: $15,000 (per year awarded) Acceptance rate: 20-30% Criteria: 2nd or 3rd year Undergraduate Despite its name, this is not a scholarship for Astronauts. It is a competitive research scholarship similar to Goldwater. Speak to your university's office of nationally competitive awards to apply. Application requires an academic resume and a personal statement. National Merit Scholarship Award: $2500 + Full ride to many Universities Acceptance rate: 1.5% Criteria: High School Students have the opportunity to take the PSAT during the third year of high school. The top 8000 scores are considered for the National Merit Scholarship. While the amount awarded is relatively small, many schools will offer full rides (tuition + room) for students named National Merit Finalists.

docs.text: Projects FPGA Implementation of Impulse Response Filters for Real-Time Spectroscopy High performance digital signal processing using IIR filters. Current project is configured to build for the Red Pitaya , a low cost ADC & DAC platform. Based on Pavel's Red Pitaya Notes . Small Angle Neutron Scattering AI AI assistant for model identification in neutron scattering data fitting. Currently an early WIP. Getting real scattering data is difficult due to confidentiality agreements. CUDA Data Analysis Library Various tools written in CUDA C++ for arbitrary linear and non-linear function fitting using the Gauss-Newton algorithm.
